Best example of pseudo-science I've ever seen!  How many years did it take the Emperor Penguin to "develope" this ability?  They had to have this adaptation before they went to Antarctica, or their feet would freeze upon arrival!  So how or why would these penguins evolve a heat exchange system in their feet so they could survive living permanently on ice if they were not living on ice?  Emperor Penguins completely disprove evolution!

The question was not answered. The countercurrent heat exchange keeps the feet colder, not warmer and thereby makes them easier to freeze. It is necessary for the penguin because it would loose warmth for the core of the body without it, but it is not an adaptation to keep the feet from freezing. And "tough" materials can freeze as easy as soft materials. They are just not so easy to damage by the cold.
